entries: The worldbreaker's body overflows with destructive ki, possessing 30 ki points. The worldbreaker can expend ki points (included in the feature's description) to take certain actions. The worldbreaker recovers all of its ki points when it finishes a short or long rest.

trait.name: Diamond Soul
entries: When the worldbreaker fails a saving throw, it can expend 4 ki points to succeed instead.

trait.name: Titanic Creature
entries: The worldbreaker is a titanic creature which is so large that combat involves dividing its body up into various sections, each of which has a fixed initiative count on which it acts (losing initiative ties), detailed in its description. Each section is considered a unique creature for purposes of targeting (in case an effect or attack would include multiple targets), and effects that include an area may affect multiple sections of the worldbreaker if the area is large enough. Each section has its own hit points and actions but shares the worldbreaker's other statistics (such as damage resistances, saving throws, etc.). When a section is reduced to 0 hit points, it becomes {@condition incapacitated} until it regains hit points or the worldbreaker is slain, which causes the section to die along with the worldbreaker. If a section has a speed, the worldbreaker can move up to that section's speed during the section's turn. Creatures can enter and occupy the same space as the worldbreaker, which is considered difficult terrain, and the worldbreaker cannot make opportunity attacks. Finally, attempts to forcibly move, banish, or magically teleport the worldbreaker or any of its parts automatically fail.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: On each of its turns, the rakshasa can use a bonus action to take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action.

trait.name: Shadow in the Night
entries: The rakshasa is {@condition invisible} when in dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The rakshasa deals an extra 35 ({@damage 10d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the rakshasa that isn't incapacitated and the rakshasa doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Tools of Assassination
entries: The rakshasa's weapons are magical and composed of fiendish green steel. The rakshasa has a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls (included in the attack) made with its talwar. If the rakshasa starts its turn and is not in possession of its talwar, the weapons magically reappear in its possession.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa makes two attacks and takes one other action.

action.name: Shadow Step
entries: The rakshasa magically teleports up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is in dim light or darkness.

action.name: Snuff Light
entries: The rakshasa blows a puff of air at a source of light from an object (such as a torch or lantern) or a magical effect (such as {@spell light}) it can see. The light is snuffed out immediately, and spells or magical effects producing light affected by this feature immediately end.

action.name: Talwar
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d8 + 8}) slashing damage. If the attack scores a critical hit, double the damage of the attack.

reaction.name: Deceptive Magic Immunity
entries: When the rakshasa is affected by a spell or magical effect, it can use its reaction to attempt a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) ability check versus the source's spell save DC. On a success, the rakshasa is unaffected and a creature of the rakshasa's choice that it can see is affected instead.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Lightning Reflexes
entries: The rakshasa has three extra reactions.

trait.name: Tools of Slaughter
entries: The rakshasa's weapons are magical and composed of fiendish green steel. The rakshasa has a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls (included in the attack) made with its greatswords. The blades vanish if held by a creature other than the rakshasa and reappear in the rakshasa's possession at the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa makes four attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is a non-evil creature, it takes an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Whirlwind Attack {@recharge 5}
entries: The rakshasa begins spinning at high speed until the end of its turn, gaining the following benefits.

items: The rakshasa's speed is doubled.
When the rakshasa comes within 10 feet of a creature for the first time on a turn, it makes two greatsword attacks against that creature.
When the rakshasa comes within 10 feet of an object or structure for the first time on a turn, it deals 50 points of slashing damage to it.
When the rakshasa comes within 10 feet of a spell or magical effect of 7th level or lower that would obstruct or prevent its movement, the effect immediately ends.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker that the rakshasa can see hits it with an attack, it can use its reaction to halve the attack's damage against it.

reaction.name: Warrior's Magic Immunity
entries: When the rakshasa is targeted by a spell or magical effect, it can use its reaction to attempt to parry it. To do so, the rakshasa makes a Greatsword attack. If the attack roll is greater than or equal to the source of the targeting spell or magical effect's save DC, the spell or magical effect is parried and instead targets the source of the spell or magical effect.

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

trait.name: Blightcaller
entries: When the rakshasa effects an area with a spell or magical effect, the ground in that area becomes corrupted. When a non-evil creature on the blighted ground attempts an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, it rolls a {@dice d8} and subtracts the number rolled from the result. Any corruption caused by this effect fades 1 month after the rakshasa leaves the locale.

trait.name: Natural Spell Immunity
entries: The rakshasa is immune to spells of 8th level or lower unless it wishes to be affected. If it chooses to be affected by a spell cast by an enemy creature, it gains a spell slot of that spell's level or lower, up to its spell slot maximum.

trait.name: Subsume Magic
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the rakshasa can choose to expend a single spell slot of 1st level or higher. When it does so, the rakshasa regains {@dice 1d8} hit points plus an additional {@dice 1d8} per level of the spell slot expended.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The rakshasa is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). The rakshasa has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rakshasa casts up to three spells: a spell of 1st level or higher and two cantrips.

action.name: Earth Reaver {@recharge}
entries: The rakshasa strikes the ground with its fist, causing a tremendous magical explosion in a 300-foot radius centered on it. Creatures standing on the ground in the area must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 78 ({@damage 12d12}) bludgeoning damage, or half as much on a success. Objects and structures in the area take double damage from this effect.

trait.name: Aura of Purity
entries: The chastity is surrounded by an aura of pure goodness in a 60-foot radius. At the start of each of the chastity's turns, each enemy creature in the area must make a Charisma ability check (no associated skill) to demonstrate its purity of spirit, the DC of which is equal to the creature's CR or character level (whichever is higher). On a failure, the creature is considered impure, gaining the following penalties against the chastity and its allies until the start of the chastity's next turn.
The creature deals half damage.
The creature has disadvantage on saving throws.
The creature feels great shame for its actions.

trait.name: Bastion of Faith
entries: When the chastity takes the {@action Dodge} action, it gains a +5 bonus to its AC for as long as it is benefitting from the {@action Dodge} action.

trait.name: Divine Conviction
entries: The chastity cannot be forced or compelled to act in a manner that goes against its morality.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The chastity's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Dedication
entries: The chastity prays for success. Until the end of its next turn, the next time the chastity forces a creature to attempt a saving throw, that creature cannot succeed on that saving throw.

action.name: Faithful Strike
entries: {@atk mw} automatic hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and 31 ({@damage 7d8}) radiant damage.

trait.name: Grace in Failure
entries: When the humility fails a saving throw or is critically hit, it regains 30 hit points.

trait.name: Humble before Grace
entries: When the humility deals damage to a creature, the creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition prone} in shame for 1 minute. A creature must remain {@condition prone} for the entire duration and immediately falls {@condition prone} if forced to its feet by outside influence. An affected creature can attempt a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Prison of Humility
entries: When the humility reduces a creature to 0 hit points, it instead reduces it to 1 hit point and magically teleports the creature onto the miniature landscape that makes up its nucleus. The creature is shrunk down to proportions appropriate for the landscape in the process. An affected creature cannot escape the nucleus by any means nor can it be restored to its original size by any power short of a {@spell wish} spell. This effect only ends if the humility is slain or the creature attains true humility and graciousness (at the humility's discretion).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The humility makes four attacks, or two attacks and one other action.

action.name: Holy Lightning
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) lightning damage.

action.name: Pride Comes before the Fall {@recharge}
entries: The humility unleashes a wave of divine energy in a 300-foot radius. Each enemy creature in that area with current hit points greater than the humility's current hit points must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or have their current hit points reduced to the humility's current hit points.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The humility magically teleports up to 500 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. When the humility appears in the space, it emits a flash of radiant light in a 30-foot radius. Enemy creatures in the area must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage, or half as much on a success.

bonus.name: Cloud Cover
entries: As a bonus action, the diligence surrounds itself with thick clouds that completely fill a 30-foot-radius sphere. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured for creatures other than the diligence and its allies. The cloud does not move with the diligence, but the diligence can re-center the cloud on itself as a bonus action. The cloud lasts until the diligence dismisses it with another bonus action or it creates a second cloud using this feature.

trait.name: Find the Center
entries: On each of its turns, if the diligence does not move from its space or take any actions other than its Heavenly Snipe attack, it deals an additional 90 ({@damage 20d8}) radiant damage on a successful hit with that attack.

trait.name: Penetrating Shots
entries: When the diligence makes a successful ranged weapon attack and exceeds the target's AC by 10 or more, the projectile pierces through the target and continues onward in a straight line away from the diligence. If the projectile encounters another creature or object along its path, that creature or object becomes a target of the attack as well (as though the diligence had made the original attack against it). If the projectile encounters a magical effect or spell that would stop it, the projectile is destroyed and the spell or magical effect ends.

trait.name: Unerring Precision
entries: The diligence's weapon attacks are magical. Additionally, the diligence has advantage on ranged attacks and its ranged attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

trait.name: Virtuous Vigilance
entries: The diligence has advantage on saving throws and ability checks against creatures with a lower Wisdom score than it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The diligence makes four Star Shot attacks, or it makes two Star Shot attacks and takes the {@action Ready} action to ready a Heavenly Snipe to use against the first enemy that moves that it can see.

action.name: Dispersion
entries: Until the end of its next turn, the diligence expands the radius of its Cloud Cover feature to 120 feet. Additionally, the diligence immediately magically teleports to an unoccupied space within the affected area.

action.name: Heavenly Snipe
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 18} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}65 ({@damage 10d10 + 10}) piercing damage and 55 ({@damage 10d10}) force damage.

action.name: Star Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 18} to hit, range 500 ft., one target. {@h}43 ({@damage 6d10 + 10}) damage.

trait.name: Fiendish Slaves
entries: When the utterance casts a spell, it can choose to treat any fiend allies that it can see as the point of origin for that spell.

Additionally, attacks made by allied fiends that can see the utterance benefit from spells and magical effects that the utterance is also benefiting from (such as {@spell hex} or {@spell foresight} spells).

trait.name: Roar of Power
entries: The utterance is incapable of speaking at any volume lower than a shout and is immune to any effect that would prevent it from speaking.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The utterance is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The utterance has the following spells prepared.

1: {@spell wish} (can only cast to grant the wishes of humanoids who are under the effects of a {@spell geas} spell cast by the utterance)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The utterance uses Manifest Fiend and then uses either Crashing Yell or casts a spell.

action.name: Crashing Yell {@recharge 4}
entries: The utterance lets loose a thunderous shout. All creatures within 10 feet of the utterance must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or take 33 ({@damage 6d10}) thunder damage and be pushed 20 feet away from the utterance and knocked {@condition prone}. A successful saving throw halves the damage and prevents both being pushed and knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hellfire Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) fire damage. If the target has resistance to fire damage, it instead does not have resistance to fire damage from this attack.

action.name: In Times of Need (1/Short Rest)
entries: The utterance uses Manifest Fiend four times.

action.name: Manifest Fiend
entries: The utterance magically manifests a being of truespeech that resembles an {@creature imp|MM} or {@creature quasit|MM}, which appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the utterance. Fiends created in this manner act on the utterance's turn and can take an action to make a Hellfire Bolt attack as though the utterance had made the attack (using the utterance's bonus to hit). The utterance can have a maximum of four fiends created in this manner; they vanish 1 hour after their creation or until the utterance is slain, whichever comes first. The creature is considered a native denizen of the plane on which it was manifested.

trait.name: Blood Armor
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the utterance can lose 5 hit points to magically shroud itself in armor made of blood, increasing its AC to 21 until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Bloodsight
entries: The utterance automatically succeeds on {@skill Perception} checks to detect flesh-and-blood creatures.

trait.name: Crimson Craft
entries: When the utterance gains temporary hit points and already has temporary hit points, the new temporary hit points are added to its temporary hit points instead of replacing them. The utterance can have a number of temporary hit points equal to its hit point maximum.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The utterance uses Blood Plague, then uses either Mirror Vitae or Life Transference.

action.name: Blood Plague
entries: A flesh-and-blood creature the utterance can see within 60 feet must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or contract a virulent disease. On a failure, wounds immediately open along the creature's skin and it loses 28 ({@dice 8d6}) hit points.

Additionally, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks while infected. At the start of each of its turns the creature can choose to attempt a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, curing the disease on a success. On a failure, the creature loses 28 ({@dice 8d6}) hit points.

action.name: Life Transference
entries: The utterance of blood loses a number of temporary hit points, and a single flesh-and-blood creature the utterance can see gains an equal number of temporary hit points. Temporary hit points gained from this feature are lost when the creature finishes a short or long rest.

action.name: Mirror Vitae
entries: The utterance chooses a creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or its blood is linked to the utterance's. While linked, when the utterance takes damage, it instead takes half damage (rounded down) and target takes the remaining damage. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the link on a success.

reaction.name: Harvest Life
entries: When a flesh-and-blood creature other than the utterance within 60 feet takes damage or loses hit points, the utterance can take a reaction to gain temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt or hit points lost. Temporary hit points gained by this feature are lost when the utterance finishes a short or long rest.

monster.name: Utterance of Erudition
languages: all with Book of Truth; otherwise

trait.name: Book of Truth
entries: The utterance carries with it a book of its research into truespeech. While the utterance is in possession of this book, it has advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws. Additionally, it can speak all languages and knows if it hears a lie. If the utterance loses this book, it can no longer use its Consult the Book or In Defense of Self abilities.

bonus.name: In Defense of Self
entries: As a bonus action on each of its turns, the utterance can cast one of the following spells at will, requiring only verbal components: {@spell dimension door}, {@spell dispel magic} (5th level), {@spell true seeing}. The utterance's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The utterance uses Consult the Book or Speak the Word, then makes two Ray of Truth attacks.

action.name: Consult the Book
entries: The utterance chooses a creature it can see within 120 feet. The utterance learns the following information about the target: current hit points, hit point maximum, and saving throw proficiencies.

action.name: Ray of Truth
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) radiant damage.

action.name: Speak the Word
entries: The utterance targets a creature it can see within 120 feet and magically causes one of the following effects.

items: {@i Despair (At Will).} The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become overwhelmed with despair for 1 minute. During this time the creature can't attack or target any creature with harmful abilities, spells, or other magical effects. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

{@i Discord (At Will).} The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or fall to bickering and arguing with everyone around it for 1 minute. During this time, it is incapable of meaningful communication and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

{@i Heal (1/Short Rest).} The target regains all its hit points. If the target is {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition stunned}, the condition ends. If the target is {@condition prone}, it can immediately take a reaction to stand up.
{@i Kill (1/Long Rest).} If the target has 100 hit points or fewer, it dies. Otherwise, this has no effect.

{@i Stun (2/Short Rest).} If the target has 150 hit points or fewer, it is {@condition stunned}. Otherwise, this has no effect. An affected target may attempt a DC 18 Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Superior Linguistics
entries: When a creature the utterance can hear within 120 feet casts a spell with a range other than touch or self, the utterance can use its reaction to choose the spell's target area or creatures. The utterance must be able to see any targets it wishes to affect in this manner.

trait.name: Powerful Words
entries: Spells and magical effects cannot prevent the utterance from speaking. Additionally, its words can always be heard and understood by those within earshot (even {@condition deafened} creatures).

trait.name: Reactive
entries: The utterance has two reactions.

trait.name: Words of Entropy
entries: At the start of each of the utterance's turns it can choose to immediately end a single effect or spell it can see with a duration greater than instantaneous.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The utterance uses Truename Research or Subjugate, then uses Truename Disruption twice against two different targets.

action.name: Subjugate
entries: The utterance commands a creature who can hear it to follow a course of activity (limited to one sentence) and force it to make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature must follow the command, taking all actions and spending movement necessary to best fulfill its terms. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until the target fulfills the command, whichever comes first. If an affected target takes damage it can immediately attempt a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Terminate
entries: The utterance deletes the truename of a creature it can see whose truename it knows. At the end of the target's next turn, it dies and its body disappears into nothingness. The target cannot be restored to life without its truename, or until a new truename is given to it.

action.name: Truename Disruption
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d10 + 8}) psychic damage plus 22 ({@damage 4d10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Truename Research
entries: The utterance attempts to discern the truename of a creature it can see within 120 feet by making a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check contested by the target's Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check. On a success, the utterance learns a fragment of the target's truename. While the utterance knows this fragment, it has advantage on all attacks, ability checks, and saving throws against the target.
Additionally, if the target is {@condition incapacitated}, the utterance can spend the next hour engaged in strenuous activity to discern the target's full truename.

reaction.name: Censure
entries: As a reaction when a creature that can hear the utterance within 120 feet takes a reaction or bonus action, it can force that creature instead take no action.

reaction.name: Rebuke
entries: As a reaction when a creature that can hear the utterance moves within 15 feet of it, the utterance can force the creature to succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage and be magically teleported to an unoccupied space the utterance can see within 60 feet.

monster.name: Shield Maiden
languages: but can only be understood by the dead and other valkyries

trait.name: Holy Armaments
entries: The maiden's weapon attacks are magical, and the maiden cannot be disarmed of her weapons or equipment. When the maiden hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 11 ({@damage 2d10}) radiant or necrotic damage (maiden's choice, included in the attack).

trait.name: Tower Shield Mastery
entries: While the maiden is not {@condition incapacitated} and wielding her shield, she has total cover against ranged attacks.

trait.name: Zeal of the Worthy
entries: While the shield maiden is not {@condition incapacitated}, humanoid creatures of her choice within 30 ft. of her cannot be reduced below 1 hit point unless the maiden chooses otherwise.

bonus.name: Rune of Warding
entries: The maiden's shield is inscribed with a powerful magical rune. As a bonus action on each of her turns, the maiden can empower the rune to gain one of the following benefits for 1 minute. This effect ends prematurely if the maiden uses this feature again.

items.name: Rune of Armor
items.entry: The maiden takes half damage from weapon attacks.

items.name: Rune of Magic
items.entry: The maiden takes half damage from spells.

items.name: Rune of Empowerment
items.entry: When the maiden attempts a saving throw or ability check, she rolls a {@dice d6} and adds the amount rolled to the result.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The maiden makes a spear and shield bash attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing plus 11 ({@dice 2d10}) radiant or necrotic (her choice).

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning plus 11 ({@dice 2d10}) radiant or necrotic (her choice). If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition unconscious} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Last Stand (1/day)
entries: The maiden pours a horn of mead down the throat of a flesh and blood creature that was slain within the last minute and attempts to restore it to life. If the creature's soul is willing, it is restored to life at its maximum hit points and regains all its features as though it had finished a long rest. After 24 hours, the creature dies and cannot be restored to life for a period of 10 years.

action.name: Star Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 18} to hit, range 500 ft., one target. {@h}43 ({@damage 6d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Wyrd Seer
languages: but can only be understood by the dead or other valkyries

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The seer can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Last Stand (1/day)
entries: The seer pours a horn of mead down the throat of a flesh and blood creature that was slain within the last minute and attempts to restore it to life. If the creature's soul is willing, it is restored to life at its maximum hit points and regains all its features as though it had finished a long rest. After 24 hours, the creature dies and cannot be restored to life for a period of 10 years.

trait.name: Trial of the Valkyries
entries: The seer emits an aura of psychic energy in a 60 ft. radius centered on it. When an enemy creature in the area deals damage to the seer, it takes psychic damage equal to the damage dealt. If this damage reduces a creature to zero hit points, it cannot willingly harm the seer again for the rest of its life.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The seer's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (Spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components.

action.name: Soul Strike
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one living creature. {@h}35 ({@damage 6d8 + 8}) radiant or necrotic damage, and the seer regains hit points equal to the damage dealt.

reaction.name: Twist of Fate
entries: When a creature within 60 ft. of the seer attempts an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, the seer instead chooses whether the creature succeeds or fails, regardless of the result.

trait.name: Deadly Charger (1/turn)
entries: When the pegasus spends movement and moves in a straight line for at least 60 ft. and either it or its rider makes a melee attack immediately at the end of that movement, the attack deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) damage for every 10 ft. traveled in the line.

trait.name: Loyalty
entries: The pegasus cannot be compelled to act in a manner that goes against the interests of its rider. Additionally, when the pegasus rolls initiative and is being ridden, it can choose to have its turn occur simultaneously to its rider.

trait.name: Soulbound
entries: While ridden, the pegasus cannot be slain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pegasus makes two hooves attacks.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., four different targets. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Planeshift (1/Short Rest)
entries: The pegasus casts the spell {@spell plane shift}. Willing creatures wishing to journey with the pegasus must be riding it, insead of linking hands.

monster.name: Brynhildr War Queen
languages: but can only be understood by the dead or other valkyries

trait.name: Adamantine Skin
entries: If the war queen takes 15 or less damage from an attack, it instead takes no damage.

trait.name: Duel of the Fates
entries: When the queen rolls initiative, it can choose to be magically transported to an unoccupied space on its personal battleground; a mystical demiplane of war and battle. When it does so, each creature within 300 ft. of the war queen can choose to accompany it, appearing in an unoccupied space of the war queen's choice on the demiplane.

This demiplane is an open battlefield approximately 300 ft. in diameter, with no cover or terrain features to speak of. The war queen cannot leave the demiplane while an enemy creature of the demiplane lives, neither can enemy creatures leave the demiplane while the war queen lives. When a creature first arrives on the demiplane, all spells and magical effects currently affecting it end, and it is restored to its hit point maximum.

If an effect would prevent this feature from occurring when the war queen rolls initiative, it instead immediately occurs at the start of each of the war queen's turns, until it takes effect, or the war queen is slain.

trait.name: Holy Armaments
entries: The war queen's weapon attacks are magical, and the queen cannot be disarmed of her weapons or equipment. When the war queen hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 22 ({@damage 4d10}) radiant or necrotic damage (queen's choice, included in the attack).

trait.name: Last Stand (1/day)
entries: The war queen pours a horn of mead down the throat of a flesh and blood creature that was slain within the last minute and attempts to restore it to life. If the creature's soul is willing, it is restored to life at its maximum hit points and regains all its features as though it had finished a long rest. After 24 hours, the creature dies and cannot be restored to life for a period of 10 years.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
entries: When the war queen fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The war queen makes four attacks, only one of which may be a shield bash, or two attacks and one other action.

action.name: Dispelling Touch
entries: The war queen ends a single magical effect of 8th level or lower within reach or currently affecting it.

action.name: Battle Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d12 + 8}) slashing plus 22 ({@dice 4d10}) radiant or necrotic.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 8}) bludgeoning plus 22 ({@dice 4d10}) radiant or necrotic. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or be knocked {@condition unconscious} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Wailing Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 22 ({@dice 4d10}) radiant or necrotic. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be unable to make any sound other than scream ferocious battle cries for 1 minute. A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

legendaryHeader: The war queen can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The war queen regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Dash
entries: The war queen moves up to her speed. If she is mounted, her mount may instead move up to its speed.

legendary.name: Defensive Formation
entries: Until the end of its next turn while the war queen is not {@condition incapacitated}, her AC is 24.

legendary.name: Strike
entries: The war queen makes an attack.

bonus.name: Aerial Combatant
entries: As a bonus action while the drakoptera is flying, it can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Dodge} action.

trait.name: Single-Minded Fury
entries: When the drakoptera rolls for initiative, it chooses a single enemy creature it is aware of and is filled with rage toward that creature, granting it the following benefits.

items: The drakoptera won't willingly attack any creature other than the chosen enemy.
The drakoptera has advantage on attack rolls against the chosen enemy.

entries: This effect ends if the drakoptera has not attacked the target for at least 1 minute or its target is slain. When the target is slain the drakoptera can immediately target another enemy creature it is aware of with this feature.

trait.name: Spell Suppression
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the drakoptera can choose to suppress a single spell or magical effect of 5th level or lower currently affecting it, becoming immune to its effects. This benefit lasts until the end of the drakoptera's turn, at which point the spell or magical effect resumes (when applicable).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drakoptera makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage, and if the target is a creature, the drakoptera may grapple it (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the drakoptera cannot bite another target.

action.name: Inject Venom {@recharge}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one {@condition grappled} target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 hour. While {@condition paralyzed} in this manner, a creature with 1 or more hit points takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns, and if reduced to 0 hit points by this damage immediately stabilizes. A {@condition paralyzed} creature can attempt a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the effect. A creature immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition has advantage on all saving throws against these effects.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d12 + 6}) piercing damage and 13 ({@damage 2d12}) poison damage.

trait.name: Armor Plating
entries: The drakuto cannot be critically hit. Additionally, while the drakuto is benefiting from the {@action Dodge} action it gains a +5 bonus to its AC.

trait.name: Spell Suppression
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the drakuto can choose to suppress a single spell or magical effect of 6th level or lower currently affecting it, becoming immune to its effects. This benefit lasts until the end of the drakuto's turn, at which point the spell or magical effect resumes (when applicable).

bonus.name: Crushing Grip
entries: On each of its turns, the drakuto may take a bonus action to deal 35 ({@damage 10d6}) bludgeoning damage to anything it is grappling.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drakuto uses Charge and makes one attack, or makes two attacks.

action.name: Charge
entries: The drakuto moves up to double its speed in a straight line. Creatures in its path must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or be trampled by the drakuto. A successful saving throw moves a creature to the nearest unoccupied space within 10 feet out of the drakuto's path. On a failure (or if there are no nearby unoccupied spaces available), a creature takes 25 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Headbutt
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. Objects and structures take quadruple damage from this attack.

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}29 ({@damage 4d10 + 7}) piercing damage, and if the target is a creature, the drakuto may grapple it (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the drakuto cannot use Pincer on another target.

reaction.name: Indomitable
entries: If the drakuto is on the ground and is pushed or pulled, it may take a reaction to prevent that movement.

monster.name: Adraknid

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: When the adraknid fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Spell Suppression
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the adraknid can choose to suppress a single spell or magical effect of 7th level or lower currently affecting it, becoming immune to its effects. This benefit lasts until the end of the adraknid's turn, at which point the spell or magical effect resumes (when applicable).

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The adraknid can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.
Additionally, the adraknid can use its webs as rope and treats its webs as a tool in which it is proficient.

trait.name: Webweaver
entries: When the adraknid moves, is moved, jumps, or falls and is not {@condition incapacitated}, it can choose to leave behind lines of webbing in a 5-foot-wide line with a length equal to the distance it moved. A creature other than the adraknid that comes into contact with the webbing for the first time on a turn or starts its turn in contact with the webbing must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 21}). The webbing can be suspended in midair between two points and is considered difficult terrain.
Additionally, the adraknid can spend 20 feet of movement to create a 20-foot square of webbing, which has an AC of 12 and 30 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The adraknid uses its Cobweb (if available), then makes three attacks, only one of which may be a Bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}33 ({@damage 4d12 + 7}) piercing damage. If the target is a flesh-and-blood creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or lose half of its current hit points (rounded down). A creature immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition has advantage on this saving throw.

action.name: Bristles
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Cobweb {@recharge 5}
entries: The adraknid fills a 30-foot cube within 120 feet of it with sticky cobwebs. Creatures within the area must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} (escape {@dc 21}) until they leave the area or the cobwebs are destroyed. A creature that successfully saves moves to the nearest unoccupied space at the edge of the area. The cobwebs are considered an object (AC 12, 100 hit points) and are vulnerable to fire damage.

action.name: Cocoon
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature {@condition restrained} by webs. The target is cocooned by the adraknid and cannot spend movement or take actions other than attempting to free itself. A creature trying to free itself can take an action to attempt a {@dc 21} Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, freeing itself and destroying the cocoon on a success. The cocoon is an object (AC 16, 50 hit points) and is vulnerable to slashing damage.

legendaryHeader: The adraknid can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The adraknid regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Bristles
entries: The adraknid makes a bristles attack.

legendary.name: Cocoon (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The adraknid makes a Cocoon attack.

legendary.name: Deadly Precision
entries: Until the end of its next turn, the next attack the adraknid makes deals an extra 36 ({@damage 8d8}) damage on a successful hit. An attack cannot benefit from this effect more than once per hit.

legendary.name: Hide
entries: The adraknid takes the {@action Hide} action.

legendary.name: Leap
entries: The adraknid jumps up to a distance and height equal to its speed.

monster.name: Drakopede

trait.name: Devastator
entries: The drakopede can spend movement to deal damage to structures adjacent to its head. The drakopede deals 50 bludgeoning damage to an object or structure within 5 feet of its head for every 10 feet spent in this manner.

trait.name: Massive
entries: The drakopede is 200 feet long and 10 feet wide, typically occupying a 50-foot-by-50-foot square on the battlefield. Attacks and effects that cannot reach its head deal half damage to the drakopede, and it is immune to any effect that would force it to attempt an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw if its head is out of range of the effect.

trait.name: Overrun
entries: The drakopede ignores nonmagical difficult terrain and damages anything in spaces through which it moves. When the drakopede moves into a space for the first time on its turn, it deals 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage to everything in that space. A creature can only take damage from this effect once per turn.

trait.name: Spell Suppression
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the drakopede can choose to suppress all spells or magical effects of 8th level or lower currently affecting it, becoming immune to those effects. This benefit lasts until the end of the drakopede's turn, at which point spells or magical effects resume (when applicable).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drakopede makes one attack—Bite, Pincer, or Spit—and up to six Claw attacks, only two of which can be against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}49 ({@damage 6d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a flesh-and-blood creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 25} Constitution saving throw or take 35 ({@damage 10d6}) acid damage. A creature immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition has advantage on this saving throw.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d8 + 10}) slashing damage, and the drakopede may grapple the target (escape {@dc 26}).

action.name: Pincer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}49 ({@damage 6d12 + 10}) slashing damage. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, it is sliced in half.

action.name: Spit
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 18} to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. {@h}73 ({@damage 14d8 + 10}) acid damage.

reaction.name: Crush Magic
entries: When the drakopede is prevented from entering a space by a spell or magical effect, it can take a reaction to attempt a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check versus the caster's spell save DC. On a success, the drakopede ends the spell or magical effect.

legendaryHeader: The drakopede can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The drakopede regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Bestial Rage
entries: The drakopede ends one condition of the following options currently affecting it: {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition stunned}, {@condition unconscious}. If one of these conditions would prevent the drakopede from taking this action, it may still take this action.

legendary.name: Claw
entries: The drakopede makes a Claw attack.

legendary.name: Rear Up
entries: The drakopede rears its head, using its lengthy body to increase its reach. Until the end of its next turn, the drakopede's reach increased by 60 feet, but it cannot spend movement.

legendary.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The drakopede makes a Bite, Pincer, or Spit attack.

legendary.name: Trample
entries: The drakopede moves up to its speed.

trait.name: Draining Aura
entries: At the start of each of its turns, creatures within 30 feet of the null tide must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or lose 19 ({@dice 3d12}) hit points and have their hit point maximum reduced to their current hit points and have their hit point maximum reduced to their current hit points. This effect can only be removed by {@spell greater restoration} or similar healing magic. If a creature's hit point maximum would be reduced to 0 by this feature, it is reduced to 1 instead.

trait.name: Void Resilience
entries: The null tide has resistance to all damage from spells and has advantage on saving throws against spells. If the null tide succeeds on a saving throw against a spell and suffers an effect on the success, it instead suffers no effect.

trait.name: Voidcasting
entries: When the null tide deals damage to a creature with a spell, the creature instead takes no damage and loses a number of hit points equal to the damage that would have been dealt (before damage resistances and immunities).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The null tide is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). The null tide has the following spells prepared, which it can cast without the need for material components:

action.name: Multispell
entries: The null tide casts two spells, one of which must be a cantrip.

action.name: Change Shape (3/Day)
entries: The null tide may change into the form of a {@creature giant eagle|MM}, {@creature hunter shark|MM}, or {@creature killer whale|MM}. Its equipment merges with its form. In its new form, it retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced with those of the new form, and it gains any special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions that the new form has but it lacks. It can cast spells with verbal or somatic components in the new form.

action.name: Voidbolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}The target loses 16 ({@dice 3d10}) hit points.

trait.name: Draining Aura
entries: At the start of each of its turns, creatures within 30 feet of the eyes that bite must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or lose 19 ({@dice 3d12}) hit points and have their hit point maximum reduced to their current hit points. This effect can only be removed by {@spell greater restoration} or similar healing magic. If a creature's hit point maximum would be reduced to 0 by this feature, it is reduced to 1 instead.

trait.name: Gaze into the Void
entries: When a creature that can see the eyes that bite starts its turn within 30 feet of it, the eyes that bite can force it to attempt a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw if the eyes that bite isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is reduced to 0 hit points. Otherwise, the creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage on a failure, or half a s much on a success. Unless surprised, a creature can avert its gaze to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If a creature does so, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against the eyes that bite until the start of its next turn. If the creature looks at the eyes that bite in the meantime, it must immediately attempt the saving throw.

trait.name: Magic Scent
entries: The eyes that bite has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) ability checks that rely on smell.
Additionally, the eyes that bite can smell spells and magical effects up to 1 mile away and can track a creature by scent up to one hour after the creature casts a spell.

trait.name: Undetectable
entries: The eyes that bite cannot be targeted by any divination magic or through magical scrying sensors. Additionally, the eyes that bite is {@condition invisible} to creatures that have one or more unexpended spell slots.

trait.name: Void Resilience
entries: The eyes that bite has resistance to all damage from spells and advantage on saving throws to resist spells. If the eyes that bite succeeds on a saving throw against a spell and suffers an effect on the success, it instead suffers no effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The eyes that bite makes two Bite attacks. The eyes that bite can replace one of its Bite attacks with Void Breath.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}The target loses 30 ({@dice 5d8 + 8}) hit points must expend one unexpended spell slot of its choice. The eyes that bite regains 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points per level of the spell slot expended.

action.name: Void Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The eyes that bite exhales void energy in a 15-foot-wide, 30-foot-long line. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or lose 52 ({@dice 8d12}) hit points, or half as much on a success.

Additionally, the affected area becomes filled with magical darkness for 1 minute. Sound cannot be produced in the area, and when an enemy creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or ends its turn within the area, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or lose 52 ({@dice 8d12}) hit points, or half as much on a success.

reaction.name: Active Nullification
entries: As a reaction when a creature the eyes that bite can see casts a spell, it can attempt to interrupt the casting. The caster must immediately expend a spell slot of 3rd level or higher as part of casting the spell, or the spell fails.

monster.name: Concert of Lost Souls
languages: understands all languages but can't speak

trait.name: Concert Of The Void
entries: A concert of lost souls is one creature, but its body is made up of four independent parts, each of which has an appearance of a medium beast of the same species. These parts are individual "lost souls" and are considered unique creatures for the purposes of targeting effects. For example, one part can be {@condition paralyzed} by a {@spell hold monster} spell while the other three are not affected, while a {@spell fireball} that affects multiple parts damages the concert multiple times. When the concert spends movement, each of its parts may move up to its speed as a part of that movement.

trait.name: Pack Of The Damned
entries: The concert of lost soul's parts can never be more than 500 ft. away from each other. If one of its parts would be moved beyond that area, it immediately reappears within 15 ft. of another one of concert's parts. Additionally, the concert has the following benefits due to its multiple independent parts.

trait.name: Draining Aura
entries: At the start of each of its turns, creatures within 10 feet of a part of a concert of lost souls must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or lose 19 ({@dice 3d12}) hit points and have their hit point maximum reduced to their current hit points. This effect can only be removed by {@spell greater restoration} or similar healing magic. If a creature's hit point maximum would be reduced to 0 by this feature, it is reduced to 1 instead. A creature within overlapping areas produced by this effect due to the creature's multiple parts must attempt the save against the aura produced by each part.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The concert has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies or parts is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally or part isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Void Resilience
entries: The concert has resistance to all damage from spells and advantage on saving throws to resist spells. If the lost soul succeeds on a saving throw against a spell and suffers an effect on the success, it instead suffers no effect.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: As a bonus action on each of its turns, the concert can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The concert makes four bite attacks; one with each of its parts.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}The target loses 30 ({@dice 5d8 + 8}) hit points. If another of the concert's parts is within 5 ft. of the target, it may take a reaction to make a single Bite attack against the target.

action.name: Cackling Laughter
entries: The concert emits a haunting cackle of laughter that can be heard up to 15 ft. away. Enemy creatures that hear the cackle must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.

monsterFluff.name: Abominable Hybrids
entries: The phrase "a wizard did it" is often offered as explanation for the most bizarre happenings in a fantasy world, and never is that more accurate with the abominable hybrids. A horrific blending of two or more animals, abominable hybrids bring the most fearsome offensive abilities of thei respective components to bear. Each time a hybrid appears, it is but one of dozens of potential combinations. As a DM, you will have to construct a hybrid to fit the needs of your game using a convenient "build a beast" system. This system starts with the hybrid base stat block, and then you add two or more {@filter animal essences|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=AE} to it, modifying its abilities and other statistics. Benefits in each essence that are marked with "(Trait)" should be included in the final creature's stat block for reference. Those that don't have that designation are just changes to be made like increasing the hybrid's ability scores or hit points, and they don't need to be copied to its stat block.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character can learn the following information about an abominable hybrid with an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) or Wisdom ({@skill Survival}) ability check. Note that because hybrids are customizable, the lore information should be adjusted based on the hybrid the character is investigating.

entries.name: The Abominable Hybrid

entries: Has transmutation gone too far? The hybrids are the obvious result of a twisted and malicious mind, for who else would meld flesh into flesh and create such an arabesque of muscle and teeth? Once, while on an expedition in the company of Archmagister King, we encountered a pack of these hybrids. He uttered such a string of profanity as cannot be reprinted in good conscience, and I have never felt more grateful for his proclivity toward all-cleansing flame. These horrors should be scorched from the multiverse, never to be seen again.
{@b Classification:} Brute
{@b Favors:} Clerics, Range, Rangers, Wisdom (Targeting), Warlocks
{@b Foils:} AC (Low), Bards, Charisma (Targeting), Rogues, Wizards

entries.caption: Abominable Hybrid Lore
rows: Abominable hybrids are bespoke monstrosities constructed by ethically bankrupt magic-users. These creatures vary in power tremendously, becoming stronger as more animal essences are fused into them. They have little to no will of their own and are slaves to their creator's agenda.

Hybrids have a dispersed neurology, with their brains wired throughout their entire body. This means they are capable of resisting mental coercion through the same immune system that fights disease, making them highly resistant to mind-affecting spells and abilities. They are formidable melee combatants lacking in ranged options.

The party learns the hybrid's list of animal essences, including two if its traits and abilities that are most impactful. If the party is researching hybrids in general rather than a specific one, they instead learn the full details of one animal essence of their choice.

entries.name: Tactics
entries: Hybrids get more complex as you add more {@filter animal essences|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=AE} to them, so we'll first provide a generic tactical plan for all hybrids and then offer specific advice for each animal essence. Hybrids are melee bruisers with a lot of hit points and comparatively low AC. They can use their Brawn over Brains trait to make Constitution saving throws in place of Intelligence or Charisma, making them strong against effects that force those saving throws. Hybrids should try to spend as much time as possible in melee and get up close to ranged attackers to prevent them exploiting the hybrid's lack of long-range abilities. You want to include at minimum two animal essences with every hybrid you build, both to be true to the namesake and because the hybrid's Multiattack is limited to taking each attack option no more than twice. Many of the animal essence options add only one attack and one recharging ability, so while that ability is recharging your hybrid will be fighting at less than full strength.

{@optfeature Essence of octopus|TPK} is one of two options for hybrids that are at home in the water, providing the Underwater Camouflage trait for effective ambushes, Water Breathing, and a swim speed. The octopus essence excels at grappling a single target, spreading its Ink Cloud so it can {@action Dash} as a bonus action, then repeatedly attacking the {@condition grappled} creature.

The other underwater option is {@optfeature essence of shark|TPK}, which likewise adds a swim speed and Water Breathing. The shark essence is all about raw damage, with its powerful Bite attack and Blood Frenzy trait that grants advantage on attack rolls against creatures that don't have all their hit points. It's a simple essencee—just get the hybrid in melee and chomp on the characters wearing the least armor.

Adding the {@optfeature essence of spider|TPK} gives a lot of new traits and changes to the hybrid's stats that make it an adept ambusher on land, particularly caverns and dungeons where it can benefit from its Spider Climb trait. Including some webs in the area helps the hybrid leverage its Web Sense and Web Walker traits for extra advantage. In combat, a hybrid with {@optfeature essence of spider|TPK} can use its Web ability to restrain a creature from a distance, locking down ranged attackers or spellcasters while it engages the rest of the party. Its Sting can be used to great effect against creatures that are low on hit points—anyone it reduces to 0 hit points is {@condition paralyzed} until the poison is cured.

The {@optfeature essence of python|TPK} provides a climb speed and {@sense blindsight}, allowing the hybrid to function in heavily obscured areas like dense fog or magical darkness. The Constrict action is a dangerous grapple attack best paired with another like the shark's Bite or the spider's Sting. The Swallow Whole attack can take a character out of the fight temporarily and is great when used against some rogues and spellcasters who may struggle to do enough damage to free themselves.

{@optfeature Essence of raptor|TPK} is the airborne option, bringing a fly speed and a powerful area-of-effect ability in Wing Attack, which can easily knock entire parties {@condition prone}. With advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks, this essence also excels against any characters that rely on being hidden.
Lastly, {@optfeature essence of turtle|TPK} gives a strong defensive boost to the hybrid. With the Withdraw action, the hybrid becomes more of a soldier-type monster, difficult to hit and hurt.

{@b Easier Tactics} - Adjusting the tactics for brute monsters is always tricky, because they don't have a lot of abilities to tweak. Follow the general advice for easier encounters: spread damage out among the party, wait a round or two before using limited-use abilities, and provoke a few opportunity attacks while moving around. You can also give the party an easier time by putting the hybrid in a large, wide-open area where its relatively slow speed gives the party a chance to pick it apart with ranged attacks.

{@b Harder Tactics} - Ambushes are a great way to start a fight, and with both the {@optfeature essence of spider|TPk} and octopus providing advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks, it's easy to make a hybrid with a talent for concealing itself. Most essence options also add a way for the hybrid to grapple a creature, and since the hybrids are Huge in size, they can move a Medium creature they are grappling without being slowed down. Combine that with swim, fly, or climb speeds and a hybrid can easily split the party by pulling one character into a hard-to-reach spot before tearing into them.

entries.name: Cavernous Sabotage
entries: An octopus-spider-python hybrid lurks in a cavern tunnel that runs between two cities. This tunnel, though never fully safe, is frequently relied on by merchants and traders. This hybrid had to be created by someone, and powerful wizards in both cities accuse each other of creating it to sabotage trade or even start a war between the cities.

entries.name: Lake Lurkers
entries: Two shark-raptor hybrids have taken up residence in a large lake and are hunting both the fish and the fishermen nearby. This lake is an important source of food for a nearby community, and unless something is done, famine is inevitable.

entries.name: Undercover Monsters
entries: An evil wizard is creating and teleporting turtle-shark-spider hybrids into different areas of a large city. These cunning beasts sequester themselves in sewers and abandoned buildings, waiting for the signal to begin their rampage. The only clue to the origin of the hybrids is a peculiar symbol branded on their backs.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: The same techniques used to create the hybrids can be used to brew highly concentrated potions called {@item elixir of animalia|TPK|elixirs of animalia}. These potions channel the essence of a particular animal to enhance the drinker's abilities, according to the Elixir of Animalia table. Different elixirs can be combined, conferring all the listed effects when consumed. The potion's effects last for 1 hour.
由你决定，制造这些药水可能要付出很大的代价。它们的制造是一种邪恶的行为，在痛苦的过程中把活生生的动物变成可食用的液体，拥抱这条道路的一方肯定会树起新的敌人。代价也可能是精神上或身体上的，造成（%0%）的水平，甚至上瘾和戒断症状。这些药水很强大，不应该免费提供给党。

entries.name: Ecology
entries: As magically created beings that are subservient to their originator, most hybrids don't have true ecology. The exceptions are those who have outlived their masters and wander the world, struggling to find a place for themselves. They possess a crude intellect more geared toward problem solving than consciousness; given time and kindness, they may be trained and perhaps even befriended. But hybrids are always feared by the uniformed, and any that are loose in the world make their lairs far away from civilization. Each one has a few quirks related to its original purpose, perhaps collecting spell scrolls or hunting down anyone with a resemblance to a famous wizard.

trait.name: Brawn over Brains (Trait)
entries: 当混血儿尝试智力或魅力救赎时，它可以改成尝试体质救赎。

trait.name: Deadly Amalgamation
entries: For every animal essence that is a part of the hybrid, its Challenge Rating increases by 2.

trait.name: Hybrid Empowerment
entries: For every two animal essences that are a part of the hybrid, its proficiency bonus increases by 1, and it gains proficiency in a single saving throw of your choice.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: 混合体用它的每一次攻击（如果有的话）进行一次攻击。混血儿可以放弃进行其中的两次攻击，而采取一个其他行动。

entries.name: Animus Arcana
entries: Despite the assurances of wizards across the world, magic is not always as controlled and precise as it might appear. Sometimes things go horribly wrong, where arcane energies pool and coalesce into an ambulatory mass of magic. These so-called animated spells (or "animus arcana" to the learned mind) developy basic sentience and are driven by a deep, insatiable hunger for power. Whether created with intention or by some catastrophic accident, these artificial beings exhibit a wide range of magical properties in association with a school of magic. Unnatural in the extreme, it is obvious to even the most meat headed barbarian that an animus arcana is magic as it was never meant to be, twisted into a perpetual existence anathema to the world around it.

Most animated spells are not, strictly speaking, a spell given life. They are agglomerations of a school of magic, compressed and contorted into a being with alien sentience. Each has a personality reflective of the school of magic that composes it. For example, a {@creature living evocation|TPK} is chaotic and destructive, while a {@creature living necromancy|TPK} is malevolent and corrupting. Barely a creature, a living spell flows across the landscape, subjecting everything in its path to potent magic according to its own mysterious whims.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character can learn the following information about animated spells with an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) ability check.

entries.caption: Animated Spells Lore
rows: Sometimes magic gathers in a solid form, becoming an animated spell. These are each tied to a school of magic and have potent powers based on that type of arcana. While their effects vary greatly, each unleashes powerful magical effects similar to spells from that school.

Each animated spell is immune to spells and magical effects associated with its school of origin. Additionally, the {@creature living abjuration|TPK} is entirely immune to spells. Each living spell channels effects associated with its parent school, but these are not cast the ways spells are, and can't be stopped by a {@spell counterspell}.

Animated spells are like elementals, they are vulnerable to spells like {@spell banishment} which require a strong force of personality to resist. They are also not especially durable, and a concentrated first strike can destroy the fragile bonds that hold them together.

entries.name: The Animated Spells

entries: The existence of animated spells has given me pause. Are they a natural reaction to the misuse of magic? Or perhaps the inevitable outcome of its use? At the very least we should rethink the way we spellcasters approach magic, for these creatures are too dangerous to not consider when practicing our arts. While not much for conversation, animated spells possess behavior and personalities befitting of the schools they hail from, and even some spellcasters who favor those schools. When Archmagister King encountered a {@creature living evocation|TPK}, the similarities between their personalities was uncanny. Albeit in a very explosive and maniacal symmetry.
{@b Classification:} Controller
{@b Favors:} Clerics, Magic (Protection from), Mobility (High), Monks, Paladins
{@b Foils:} Barbarians, Fighters, Melee Spells (Limited Variety), Warlocks

entries.name: Tactics
entries: Every animated spell has the same three traits. Spellform allows the living spell to move through creatures and objects, and it inflicts an effect upon moving through a creature's space. This is an important part of the living spell's combat tactics and it should take a few opportunity attacks to inflict this ability on as many characters as possible. Immutable Form and Magic Immunity are simple traits, but they are important to remember. Each time a character casts a spell targeting a living spell, ask the player what school of magic the spell is from.

Each animated spell has a few unique abilities themed around its school. Most have one ability that it can use repeatedly, and another more powerful effect that, if successful, kills the animated spell when used. The latter effect should be saved until a few rounds into the fight, after the animated spell has lost more than half of its hit points. Several animate spells pose little threat in isolation and require allies to make for a challenging encounter. Pair animate spells with other constructs or creatures resistant to magic for best results.

entries.name: Talien's Notes
entries: Unregulated and unrestricted use of magic is a grave threat both philosophically and practically. I have not yet identified an exhaustive and comprehensive list of situations which may give rise to an animated spell, but there are some certainties. First, sorcerers are more likely to create them. This is not prejudice, it is fact. Second, magic that is long-suppressed by an {@spell antimagic field} may become animated spells when that {@spell antimagic field} is removed. Third and lastly, Shana Troublefoot leaves these in her wake like my cat leaves traces of its fur everywhere. It is academically fascinating and personally incredibly frustrating. And dangerous.

{@b Easier Tactics} - Don't use the ability that causes the spell to die or use it immediately. Both approaches make them easier to deal with. Don't have the creature move into more than a single character's space at a time, allowing the party a chance to understand and mitigate the effect before subjecting themselves further.

{@b Harder Tactics} - Try to have the animated spells use their self-killing abilities only when they are nearly dead and move them around as much as possible to trigger their Spellform trait. The spell's inherent cunning should let them pick targets vulnerable to its effects and may be paired with creatures able to quickly capitalize on the results of the spell's attacks.

entries.name: AN EXCELLENT DAY FOR SCIENCE!
entries: A gnome wizard has lived up to the unfortunate stereotype of creating magical mayhem, simultaneously creating one of each type of animated spell. Even more unfortunately, the gnome had no plan to contain the spells once created, which quickly escaped his tower and are loose upon the countryside.

entries.name: Death Marches
entries: A powerful necromancer has shackled five {@creature living necromancy|TPK|living necromancies} to her service, using them as powerful support forces for her undead army. Her strategy of {@creature wight|MM} foot soldiers supported by the animated spells has proven to be nearly unstoppable, titled the "death march" by those who have faced it in battle.

entries.name: Magical Mayhem
entries: Something is dreadfully wrong with the fabric of magic. Whenever a high-level spell is cast, an animated spell is created alongside the effect. This has already caused no small amount of chaos, and inspired a blanket ban on high level spellcasting until a solution can be discovered.

entries.name: Treasure
entries: Animated spells are composed of enduring magical energy, shapeless and malformed by its existence. While "naturally" spawned animate spells are hostile to all life, if one can carve off a piece of a living one, they will find it can grow into a new animus arcana of the same type. Carving off a slice takes delicate precision, requiring a successful melee weapon attack against an animus arcana with a magical weapon that deals slashing damage, along with a DC 22 Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check to do so with surgical precision. On a success, the still living piece can be stored inside a container that is designed to suppress its Spellform feature. If nurtured with magic from its associated school, the "infant" animus arcana will grow to full size within a period of one year, completely loyal and subservient to its parent. These "tame" animate spells are highly prized and are a testament to the magical skill and ingenuity of their masters.

entries.name: Ecology
entries: Animate spells lack the intellect to have long-term goals and have no metabolism to sustain, so they spend most of their time dormant. Occasionally, for reasons none can determine, they will activate their abilities a few times before returning to a quiescent state. They are ruthlessly hostile toward living creatures, from the most powerful dragon to the tiniest beast, and have no feelings of fear or doubt. They will recklessly charge creatures that could easily destroy them, and as such, most animate spells are short lived unless they manifest in a sparsely populated area. These creatures can appear wherever powerful magic is being cast in high concentrations, though they have been known to form in areas of epically powerful or ancient magic as well. There is a rare and ancient spell that is known to summon animate spells, but such magic has been lost to time.

dataSpell.name: Animate Magic
entries: A magical effect is transformed into a being of living magic, an animate spell. Choose a spell effect of 6th level or higher within range. That spell ends, and an animate spell is formed in a space of your choice within range of the spell. The animate spell is of a school according to the effect you targeted. For example, if you targeted an evocation spell with this spell, you would create a {@creature living evocation|TPK}. You cannot command the animate spell, which is an independent creature beyond your control, though it is initially friendly to you and your allies.

A maelstrom of sentient magical chaos, the living spellstorm unleashes apocalyptic magic of staggering proportions. Formed from titanic magical conflicts, a spellstorm has no regard for the concerns of the material, raging against its own existence and the world around it. A typical living spellstorm is a swirling cloud of magic energy, thundering across the landscape while emitting prismatic magical radiation. Generations of magical scholars have attempted to explain the nature of the living spellstorms. Bards theorize the existence of a spellstorm comes from poorly performed magic on an epidemic scale. Clerics believe they are messengers of the gods, sent to punish magic users for their hubris. Druids postulate that nature created these animus arcana to restore balance to an increasingly unnatural world. Sorcerers simply claim that it is the inherent chaos in all magic, a freak accident that cannot be understood. Wizards have no prevailing theory, instead discrediting competing perspectives and arguing endlessly over who is the closest to the truth.

entries.name: Lore
entries: A character can learn the following information about a living spellstorm with an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) ability check.

entries.caption: Living Spellstorm Lore
rows: Living spellstorms do incredible amounts of damage, unleashing magical meteors, devastating lighting, and literal tornadoes. Find cover immediately to avoid the worst of it, but don't expect that to save you.

A spellstorm can disrupt nearby spellcasting that is not performed skillfully enough. Its legendary nature allows for a torrential barrage of spells and attacks, all of which are magical in nature. These effects are extremely difficult to resist or dodge, and all but the most powerful defensive magic will be dispelled by the animus.

Never pick a fight with a spellstorm until you have done everything in your power to gain an advantage. Out healing its damage is nearly impossible, the best you can do it keep on your feet and pour on the damage as quickly as possible. Flight is essential to victory, don't even bother trying if you cannot take to the skies.

entries.name: The Living Spellstorm

entries: Magic at its most dangerous and unpredictable, a living spellstorm serves as a reminder to all spellcasters that we are but children playing with an enigmatic force. What a wizard spends their life trying to master, a spellstorm achieves by merely existing. I consulted my other magical companions on the matter of living spellstorm, and each offered their unique perspective. Archmagister King simply dictated "I need it". I still don't know what for. Ionia lamented its existence, calling it "a wound in nature, festering with agony and pain". Elkus said he'd "consult the gods and get back to me". He never did, so I can only assume he learned nothing of value. Shana went off to try and find one and I haven't heard from her since, and Johan sent me a formal letter in response stating: "Legal counsel has advised me to not discuss this matter further". Clearly, I am the only one among my companions who respects the value of research!
{@b Classification:} Elite
{@b Favors:} Bards, Flight, Range, Rogues, Warlocks
{@b Foils:} Clerics, Hit Points (Low), Melee, Monks, Paladins

entries.name: Tactics
entries: The living spellstorm has numerous traits and abilities, making it far more formidable than its animate spell brethren. It retains the Spellform and Immutable form traits, which work as expected, but also has the Tempst of Magic trait which creates a gigantic maelstrom around the living spellstorm and has a tremendous impact on the way the fight plays out. The spellstorm can cast spells using its Innate Spellcasting trait, which it should use to cast {@spell meteor swarm} on approaching threats that are still a mile away. It is intelligent and should be ready to cast {@spell planeshift} if it needs to make a swift getaway.

On its turns, the living spellstorm is best served by starting with Cyclone to deal heavy damage in a huge area, and then make two attacks with Arc Lightning against anyone who is {@condition restrained} in the Cyclone. After that, use Empower and continue to make two attacks with Arc Lightning against {@condition restrained} creatures for as long as the Cyclone persists. Use the spellstorm's legendary actions to cast a spell and then make one Lightning Strike. When casting spells, prioritize removing magical effects with {@spell dispel magic} or moving the spellstorm with {@spell dimension door} if it needs some breathing room.

{@b Easier Tactics} - Have the spellstorm cast {@spell storm of vengeance} in place of {@spell meteor swarm} and keep the fight low to the ground.
